Class SouthSlope

java.lang.Object

public class SouthSlope
extends StaticObject

A subclass of StaticObject representing a Southward slope.

phedman

Constructor Detail

SouthSlope

public SouthSlope(Drawable _tile,
                  Drawable _lower,
                  double _height,
                  int x,
                  int y)
Constructs a SouthSlope and sets the tile position of the object and the Drawables it is associated with by passing the parameters to the parent constructor.

Parameters:
_tile - The Drawable the object actually represents.
_lower - The Drawbles to be piled under it in order to create columns.
_height - The height the StaticObject will reside at
x - The x coordinate in tile coordinates (isometric, 1 unit per tile)
y - The y coordinate in tile coordinates (isometric, 1 unit per tile)
Method Detail

getHeight

public double getHeight(double x,
                        double y)
Calculates the height at the position located at x, y (isometric coordinates) on the tile.

Specified by:
getHeight in class StaticObject
Parameters:
x - The x coordinate on the tile.
y - The y coordinate on the tile.
Returns:
The height at (x,y)
